trends: There has been one other sighting in Mercer
There were no other sightings in Mercer on or around July 22nd 2004
This sighting has been favorited 1 time.
divs: sighting detailswe were sitting around the campfire at the cabin. celebrating multiple b-days with relatives and friends. i am an amatuer astronomer so i am always looking up. i noticd 4 white lights moving rather fast, just south of polaris. by the time i told someone to look. all 4 lights stopped and went in a right angle up and dissappeared into the stars. i went "whoaaa!" and everyone said "have another one" i told them what i saw, and obviously no one believed me. then about 10 min's later. there they were again! only a slightly different pattern this time and they appeared out of nowhere. i told everyne to look up. they finally saw them. they zigzagged across the northern sky, and then slowly moved up until they just dissappeared. i know it was no satellite, no upper atmosphere disturbance\ auroura. or any astronomical phenom. it was very unlikly to be a plane twice! aspecially the second time zigzagging. one of the girls was visibally shaken, i was very intrigued at what happened and started to dismiss all factors that it could have been. i felt, "well i know they are out there, i just got lucky and saw one!" (4?)
Object Flight Path: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
